snippet: The Volcker Rule may be a great example of how having multiple regulators may create a patchwork of regulations, but also provide important backstops, David Zaring writes in an Another View column.
abstract: The Volcker Rule may be a great example of how having multiple regulators may create a patchwork of regulations, but also provide important backstops, David Zaring writes in an Another View column.

headline.main: With the Volcker Rule, the More Regulators the Merrier
